intro: Sopubia ramosa, commonly known as the branched thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a tall, spiny stem with branches that often bear clusters of purple or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Sopubia ramosa is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
